title.narrative: 06-03 INSTITUTIONS CAPACITY PREVENT&RESP

description.narrative: By the end of 2017, state services (health, education, security, social and judicial protection) and civil society organizations, in the targeted areas, are able to prevent and respond to violence against girls and a boys (with particular attention on birth Registration, FGM and child marriages and early pregnancy) including in emergencies, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end of 2017, 60% of children (girls and boys), adolescents and women, particularly the most vulnerable in priority intervention areas, enjoy adequate protection against exploitation, abuse, violence and benefit from socio-professional reintegration birth registration is improved from 43 to 70% FGM/C, early pregnancies and child marriages under 15 are reduced by 5% and 15% for those under 18.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2017, state services (health, education, security, social and judicial protection) and civil societyorganizations, in the targeted areas, are able to prevent and respond to violence against girls and a boys (with particularattention on birth Registration, FGM and child marriages and early pregnancy) including in emergencies

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support community based child protection networks to prevent violence, abuse and exploitation, and identify and refer children victims or at risks. A total number of 143,924 children have benefitted from at least one service. 5,797 girls were protected from female genital mutilation; 8,153 protected from child marriage. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2017
